item.title: About
item.description: The Agronomy Field Information Management System (**(AgroFIMS)**AgroFIMS) allows users to create fieldbooks to collect agronomic data. The fieldbook is already tied to a metadata standard (the CG Core Metadata Schema, aligned with the industry standard Dublin Core Metadata Schema and required by CGIAR and many other repositories). The data variables and protocol parameters in AgroFIMS fieldbooks align with semantic standards like the and semantic standards like the **Agronomy Ontology** (AgrO). This a priori compliance with data standards facilitates data to be Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Reusable (FAIR) at collection, making it easier to interpret and aggregate.

item.title: AgroFIMS workflow
item.description: AgroFIMS works in collaboration with Android applications like KDSmart, ODK Collect and Field Book to provide a complete standards-compliant workflow, from picking data variables and experimental protocol parameters to create an Excel fieldbook, through data analysis and upload to data repositories. Below are the different steps to follow to create, collect, analyze and save data using AgroFIMS:
